member.name: M:DSCore.Color.BuildColorFrom1DRange(System.Collections.Generic.List{DSCore.Color},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Double},System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a color from a color gradient between a start color and an end color.
member.param: The values between 0 and 1 along the range for which you would like to sample the color.

member.name: M:DSCore.Color.Lerp(DSCore.Color,DSCore.Color,System.Double)
member.summary: Linearly interpolate between two colors.

members.member:
Bilinearly interpolate between a set of colors.
The interpolated color or white. This algorithm is not the same as the solution found from wikipedia (reference: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bilinear_interpolation)

member.name: M:DSCore.Color.Add(DSCore.Color,DSCore.Color)
member.summary: Construct a Color by combining two input Colors.

member.name: M:DSCore.Color.Multiply(DSCore.Color,System.Double)
member.summary: Multiply an input color with a number multiplier to produce a darker color. Input color must have an alpha less than 255.

member.name: M:DSCore.Color.Divide(DSCore.Color,System.Double)
member.summary: Divide an input color with a number divider to produce a brighter color and remove color tint

member.summary: Returns the color in this color range at the specified parameter.

member.summary: The earliest date and time that can be represented.

member.summary: The latest date and time that can be represented.

member.name: P:DSCore.DateTime.Now
member.summary: The current system date and time.

member.name: P:DSCore.DateTime.Today
member.summary: The current system date, with time set at midnight.

member.name: M:DSCore.DateTime.Format(System.DateTime,System.String)
member.summary: Return a specified date and time as a string, in the specified format.
member.param: String representation of the date format. Uses InvariantCulture, which outputs independent of the user's operating system language. Defaults to standard format "F" : "Tuesday, 21 February 2017 23:02:43" Search "MSDN Custom Date and Time Format Strings" for a comprehensive list of format specifiers.
member.returns: The specified date and time as a string, in the specified format.

member.summary: Creates a new DateTime at an exact date.

member.summary: Creates a new DateTime at an exact date and time.

member.summary: Subtracts a TimeSpan from a DateTime, yielding a new DateTime.

member.summary: Adds a TimeSpan to a DateTime, yielding a new DateTime.

member.summary: Calculates how many days are in the given month of the given year.

member.summary: Check if the number of items in all rows of the list are the same.

member.returns: Whether the list has the same number of items in all rows.

member.summary: Check if the items in the list have the same depth.

member.returns: Whether the depth of the list is uniform.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.SetDifference(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Object})
member.summary: Returns a new list that includes objects in List1 but excludes objects in List2.
member.param: List of objects to be included in the new list.
List of objects to be excluded in the new list.
member.returns: The new list that contains objects in List1 but not in List2.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.SetIntersection(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Object})
member.summary: Returns a new list that includes objects that are present in both List1 and List2.
member.param: List of objects to be compared with list2.
List of objects to be compared with list1.
member.returns: The new list that contains objects that are in both List1 and List2.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.SetUnion(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Object})
member.summary: Returns a new list that includes objects that are present in either List1 or List2.
member.param: List of objects to be included.
List of objects to be included to List1.
member.returns: The new list that contains objects that are either in List1 or List2.

member.summary: Returns the index of the element in the given list.
member.param: The list to find the element in.
The element whose index is to be returned.
member.returns: The index of the element in the list.

member.summary: Returns the number of false boolean values in the given list.

member.summary: Returns the number of true boolean values in the given list.

The index ranges of the sublist elements. Ex. \"{0..3,5,2}\"
The offset to apply to the sublist. Ex. the range \"0..3\" with an offset of 2 will yield {0,1,2,3}{2,3,4,5}{4,5,6,7}...

key value corresponding to each group

member.name: M:DSCore.List.TakeItems(System.Collections.IList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetches an amount of items from the start of the list.
member.param: Amount of items to take. If negative, items are taken from the end of the list.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.DropItems(System.Collections.IList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes an amount of items from the start of the list. If the amount is a negative value, items are removed from the end of the list.
member.param: Amount of items to remove. If negative, items are removed from the end of the list.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.ShiftIndices(System.Collections.IList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Shifts indices in the list to the right by the given amount.
member.param: Amount to shift indices by. If negative, indices will be shifted to the left.

member.summary: Returns an item from the given list that's located at the specified index.
member.param: List to fetch an item from.
Index of the item to be fetched.
member.returns: Item in the list at the given index.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.ReplaceItemAtIndex(System.Collections.IList,System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: Replace an item from the given list that's located at the specified index.
member.param: List to replace an item in.
Index of the item to be replaced.
member.returns: A new list with the item replaced.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.Slice(System.Collections.IList,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a single sub-list from the given list, based on starting index, ending index, and a step amount.
member.param: List to take a slice of.
Index to start the slice from.
Index to end the slice at.
Amount the indices of the items are separate by in the original list.
member.returns: Items in the slice of the given list.

member.summary: Removes an item from the given list at the specified index.

member.summary: Removes items from the given list at indices that are multiples of the given value, after the given offset.
member.param: Indices that are multiples of this argument will be removed.
Amount of items to be ignored from the start of the list.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.TakeEveryNthItem(System.Collections.IList,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fetches items from the given list at indices that are multiples of the given value, after the given offset.
member.param: Indices that are multiples of this number (after the offset) will be fetched.
Amount of items to be ignored from the start of the list.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.Transpose(System.Collections.IList)
member.summary: Swaps rows and columns in a list of lists. If there are some rows that are shorter than others, null values are inserted as place holders in the resultant array such that it is always rectangular.
member.param: A list of lists to be transposed.

member.summary: Cleans data of nulls and empty lists from a given list of arbitrary dimension
member.param: Provide an option to preserve the indices of the data such that non-trailing nulls may not be filtered out
member.returns: A list cleaned of nulls and empty lists

member.name: M:DSCore.List.OfRepeatedItem(System.Object,System.Int32)

member.name: M:DSCore.List.FirstIndexOf(System.Collections.IList,System.Object)
member.summary: Given an item, returns the zero-based index of its first occurrence in the list. If the item cannot be found in the list, -1 is returned.
member.param: List to search in. If this argument is null, -1 is returned.
member.returns: Zero-based index of the item in the list, or -1 if it is not found.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.AllIndicesOf(System.Collections.IList,System.Object)
member.summary: Given an item, returns the zero-based indices of all its occurrences in the list. If the item cannot be found, an empty list is returned.
member.param: List to search in. If this argument is null, an empty list is returned.
member.returns: A list of zero-based indices of all occurrences of the item if found, or an empty list if the item does not exist in the list.

member.summary: Flattens a nested list of lists by a certain amount.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.IndexInList(System.Collections.IList,System.Object)
member.summary: An alternative to using IList.Contains which uses Enumerable.SequenceEqual to check if the item is contained in the list if the item is an array. Returns the index if found, -1 if not found.
member.param: The list to check if it contains the item.
The item that needs to be found.
member.returns: Index of the item in the list.

The boolean value to be found

member.name: M:DSCore.List.IncreaseDepth(System.Collections.IList,System.Int32)
member.summary: Increase the depth of a given list by a specified amount. Depth is increased by creating a new list to contain the given list.
member.param: The list whose depth is to be increased.
The amount the depth is to be increased by.
member.returns: The new list whose depth is increased by amt.

member.name: M:DSCore.List.DoubleConverter(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts integer to double, else returns the input object.

member.name: T:DSCore.ObjectComparer
member.summary: Implements Compare function for two objects using following rule. 1. Numbers are assumed to be smallest, then bool, string and pointers. 2. If the two objects are IComparable and of the same type, then use it's native comparison mechanism. 3. If both inputs are value type, but one of them is bool, bool is bigger 4. Otherwise Convert them all to double and compare. 5. Else If only one is value type, then value type object is smaller 6. Else If only one is string, then the string is smaller than other 7. Else don't know how to compare, so best campare them based on HashCode.

member.summary: Removes characters from a string.
member.param: Index at which to start removal.
Amount of characters to remove, by default will remove all characters from the given startIndex to the end of the string. Note: if the Count is negative, the removal process goes from right to left.
